meanings.definition: To make excessively tired or fatigued.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, the steep climb overtired me.
meanings.sent2: Staying up late studying can overtire students before exams.
meanings.sent3: The idea of running a marathon in flip flops is overtiring.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise of the city overtires my mind like a never-ending race.
meanings.sent5: The demanding job overtires him to the point of falling asleep at his desk.

meanings.definition: Exhausting to the point of extreme fatigue.
meanings.sent1: The overtiring workout left her muscles sore for days.
meanings.sent2: The overtiring journey through the desert drained all their energy.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a heavy backpack in the rain felt overtiring but comical.
meanings.sent4: The overtiring heat of the sun beat down on the tired travelers.
meanings.sent5: The overtiring task of moving furniture felt like lifting mountains.
